text.__SUMMARY__:
Wahlenbergia luteola is a small herbaceous plant in the family Campanulaceae native to eastern Australia.
The tufted perennial herb typically grows to a height of 0.06 to 0.80 metres (0 to 3 ft). It blooms throughout the year producing blue-yellow-white flowers.The species is found in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia.
